trans-unit.source: Make a new management service
trans-unit.target: Make a new management service

trans-unit.source: This document introduces VM Services built on Hyper-V sockets and how to get started using them.
trans-unit.target: This document introduces VM Services built on Hyper-V sockets and how to get started using them.

trans-unit.source: What is a VM Service?
trans-unit.target: What is a VM Service?

trans-unit.source: VM Services are services that span the Hyper-V host and virtual machines running on the host.
trans-unit.target: VM Services are services that span the Hyper-V host and virtual machines running on the host.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V now (Windows 10 and Server 2016+) provides a non-network connection which allows you to create services spanning the host/virtual machine boundary while preserving Hyper-V’s fundamental requirements around tenant/hoster isolation, control, and diagnosable.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V now (Windows 10 and Server 2016+) provides a non-network connection which allows you to create services spanning the host/virtual machine boundary while preserving Hyper-V’s fundamental requirements around tenant/hoster isolation, control, and diagnosable.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V will continue to provide a base set of in-box services (integration services) for basics (such as time sync) and for common requests we receive, but now anyone can write and deploy a VM service as needed.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V will continue to provide a base set of in-box services (integration services) for basics (such as time sync) and for common requests we receive, but now anyone can write and deploy a VM service as needed.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell Direct is an in-box example of a VM Service.
trans-unit.target: PowerShell Direct is an in-box example of a VM Service.

trans-unit.source: What is a Hyper-V socket?
trans-unit.target: What is a Hyper-V socket?

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V sockets are TCP-like sockets with no dependence on networking.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V sockets are TCP-like sockets with no dependence on networking.

trans-unit.source: Using Hyper-V sockets, services can run independently of the networking stack and all data flow stays on host memory.
trans-unit.target: Using Hyper-V sockets, services can run independently of the networking stack and all data flow stays on host memory.

trans-unit.source: Capabilities and Limitations
trans-unit.target: Capabilities and Limitations

trans-unit.source: Kernel mode or user mode Data stream only No block memory so not the best for backup/video
trans-unit.target: Kernel mode or user mode Data stream only No block memory so not the best for backup/video

trans-unit.source: Getting started
trans-unit.target: Getting started

trans-unit.source: This guide assumes you're familiar with socket programming in C/C++.
trans-unit.target: This guide assumes you're familiar with socket programming in C/C++.

trans-unit.source: Step 1 - Register your service on the Hyper-V host
trans-unit.target: Step 1 - Register your service on the Hyper-V host

trans-unit.source: In order to use a custom service integrated with Hyper-V, the new service must be registered with the Hyper-V Host's registry.
trans-unit.target: In order to use a custom service integrated with Hyper-V, the new service must be registered with the Hyper-V Host's registry.

trans-unit.source: By registering the service in the registry, you get:
trans-unit.target: By registering the service in the registry, you get:

trans-unit.source: WMI management for enable, disable, and listing available services
trans-unit.target: WMI management for enable, disable, and listing available services

trans-unit.source: Onto the list of services allowed to communicate with virtual machines directly.
trans-unit.target: Onto the list of services allowed to communicate with virtual machines directly.

trans-unit.source: * Registry location and information *
trans-unit.target: * Registry location and information *

trans-unit.source: In this registry location, you'll see several GUIDS.
trans-unit.target: In this registry location, you'll see several GUIDS.

trans-unit.source: Those are our in-box services.
trans-unit.target: Those are our in-box services.

trans-unit.source: Information in the registry per service:
trans-unit.target: Information in the registry per service:

trans-unit.source: Service GUID
trans-unit.target: Service GUID

trans-unit.source: ElementName (REG_SZ) -- this is the service's friendly name
trans-unit.target: ElementName (REG_SZ) -- this is the service's friendly name

trans-unit.source: To register your own service, create a new registry key using your own GUID and friendly name.
trans-unit.target: To register your own service, create a new registry key using your own GUID and friendly name.

trans-unit.source: The registry entry will look like this:
trans-unit.target: The registry entry will look like this:

trans-unit.source: More information about AF_HYPERV
trans-unit.target: More information about AF_HYPERV

trans-unit.source: Since Hyper-V sockets do not depend on a networking stack, TCP/IP, DNS, etc. the socket end point needed a non-IP, not hostname, format that still describes the connection.
trans-unit.target: Since Hyper-V sockets do not depend on a networking stack, TCP/IP, DNS, etc. the socket end point needed a non-IP, not hostname, format that still describes the connection.

trans-unit.source: In lieu of an IP or hostname, AF_HYPERV endpoints rely heavily on two GUIDS:
trans-unit.target: In lieu of an IP or hostname, AF_HYPERV endpoints rely heavily on two GUIDS:

trans-unit.source: VM ID – this is the unique ID assigned per VM.
trans-unit.target: VM ID – this is the unique ID assigned per VM.

trans-unit.source: A VM’s ID can be found using the following PowerShell snippet.
trans-unit.target: A VM’s ID can be found using the following PowerShell snippet.

trans-unit.source: Service ID – GUID under which the service is registered in the Hyper-V host registry.
trans-unit.target: Service ID – GUID under which the service is registered in the Hyper-V host registry.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Registering a New Service</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Registering a New Service</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For connections from a service on the host to the service on a VM: VMID and Service ID For connections from a service on a VM to the service on the host: Zero GUID and Service ID
trans-unit.target: For connections from a service on the host to the service on a VM: VMID and Service ID For connections from a service on a VM to the service on the host: Zero GUID and Service ID
